content: one stitch on the third row rs of each 4-row repeat r1 rs sl1 knitwise k2tog k to end of row 1 st decreased r2 ws sl1 purlwise p to end of row r3 rs sl1 knitwise k to end of row r4 ws sl1 purlwise p to end of row repeat row 1-4 until you have 3 sts left on your needles then cast off with your preferred technique adding lines orient your work so that the cast on edge is pointing towards you and the opposite tip points away with your crochet hook on the right side and your yarn behind crochet one stitch from back to front on each row of your first purl groove creating a chain that resembles knit stitches from the bottom up repeat for every purl groove i-cord an i-cord is worked around the border of your shawlette starting at the right hand side of your co edge continuing down to the center corner up to the opposite tip and back to the co set-up with c4 co 3 sts on your right needle r1 enter your right needle from front to back through the left leg of your first slipped stitch pick up one stitch r2 slip all stitches from your right to left needle k2 k2tog repeat row 1 and 2 until you reach the opposite tip at the opposite tip repeat row 1 and 2 three times into the same stitch to create a nice turning point tip repeat row 1 and 2 until you reach the co repeat the turning point tip join the beginning and end of the i-cord with the kitchener stitch weave your ends and wet block your shawlette avril ©lolita le provost 2023 not for reproduction resale or commercial manufacture
